title: Epitaph for Zotikos’ son
support: Four joining marble fragments, damaged on the left and below. The larger fragment is set in plaster. Kaibel probably read the inscription intact.

handNote.lettering: Irregular letters: rhomboid Θ, Ο and Ω, angular Μ, ΤΗ in ligature at l. 5. Presence of two ivy leaves at the beginning and at the end of l. 6 (the last one seen by Kaibel)

date._: 2nd century CE or first half of 3rd century CE

provenanceFound._: Found by the Prince of Biscari in 1750 "in un orto del barone delli Ficarazzi vicino le mura della selva del Convento de' pp. Riformati di S. Maria di Gesù".

provenanceObserved._: Observed by Kaibel in Museo Biscari, later by Korhonen in magazzino del cortile, Collezione Biscari (formerly sala VI.77).

facsimile.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo Liceo Lazzaro 10.01.2018

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
